text:
"Tentu saja tidak, Yang... ah, Tenten." Kata Neji, seraya menyuapkan sobanya. Begitu sobanya menyentuh lidahnya, Neji membelalakkan matanya.
"Enak! Rasanya agak berbeda dari soba herring yang biasa hamba makan, tapi ini benar-benar enak Yang Mu... Tenten." Kata Neji senang.
"Aku senang kau menyukainya. Itu masakan buatanku yang menggunakan bumbu dari Konoha. Gunakan bahasa yang santai saja, Neji. Tidak perlu terlalu formal padaku." Kata Tenten sambil menyuap soba herring ke mulutnya.
"Anda...maksudku... kau memasak sendiri?" tanya Neji tak percaya, sebab jarang sekali bangsawan yang mau masuk ke dapur.
"Iya, Neji. Disini aku selalu memasak sendiri. Masakan Suna menurutku terkadang terlalu hambar, tapi sekalinya pedas, pedas sekali. Rempahnya kurang bervariasi. Tidak seperti di Konoha." Jelas Tenten.
trans:
"Of course not, Your... ah, Tenten." Neji said, while feeding himself the soba. As soon as the soba touched his tongue, Neji's eyes widened.
"Delicious! The taste is a bit different from the herring soba that I usually eat, but this is truly delightful, Your Ma... Tenten." Neji said happily.
"I'm glad you liked it. It's my homemade dish that uses spices from Konoha. Use casual language, Neji. There's no need to be too formal with me." Tenten said as she spooned the herring soba into her mouth.
"You... I mean... you cooked it yourself?" Neji asked in disbelief, for it was rare for a noble to venture into the kitchen.
"Yes, Neji. Here I always cook myself. I find Suna cuisine to be somewhat bland at times, but when it is spicy, it is extremely so. The variety of spices is lacking. It's not like in Konoha." Tenten explained.
